Give a try to Interactors.

Need food

Milky, in 20 April 2014

I've been playing with interactors for a few weeks, and I have to admit I like the way it behave. It's a neat way to separate this kind of code, you either put in controller methods (bad) or in this fat model (have you seen my five hundreds lines User class ?).

It's basically a service object, with some helper methods, the ability to decide if the action you initiate failed or not, and rollback possibilities. None of this is really new, but all together it makes a nice and really useful plain-ruby object. I recommend you to read this article, and to test it. You probably have somewhere this huge process_stuff or update_this_regarding_that method you can give a try on.

I won't re-write the doc, I'd rather like to look further in the interactor gem code.
